questions.clue: This painting by Leonardo da Vinci, celebrated for its enigmatic expression, is housed in the Louvre Museum.
This artist sculpted the iconic marble statue of David before the age of 30.
This publishing innovation, perfected by Johannes Gutenberg in the 15th century, revolutionized art and literature in the Renaissance.
This technique, known for its use of light and shadow to give the illusion of depth, was perfected during the Renaissance.
Giorgio Vasari's book, considered the first art history publication, details the lives of key Renaissance artists.
questions.answer: Lives of the Most Excellent Painters, Sculptors, and Architects

questions.clue: This technology revolutionized the way we communicate wirelessly in 2007 with the release of Apple's iPhone.
This invention, introduced by Sony in the late 1970s, allowed people to listen to music on the go for the first time.
In 1990, this programming language was developed with the goal of enabling the creation of new applications for the growing World Wide Web.
Used to power electric vehicles, this type of battery offers high energy density and was commercialized by Sony in 1991.
This cloud computing model enables on-demand delivery of IT resources and applications via the internet with a pay-as-you-go pricing.
This city has been the capital of France since the 10th century.
In 1790, this city became the capital of the United States.
Originally built by the Aztecs, this city became the capital of New Spain in the 16th century.
The capital of this island nation, Colombo, was replaced by Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte as the official capital in the 1980s.
In 1960, this Brazilian city was inaugurated as the country's capital, replacing Rio de Janeiro.
Often served with soy sauce, this popular Japanese dish includes vinegared rice and seafood or vegetables.
This Italian dish made from thinly rolled dough, topped with tomato sauce and cheese, is often baked until the cheese is bubbly.
Originating in India, this dish involves marinated meat cooked on a skewer over a grill.
A traditional Korean side dish consisting of fermented vegetables, most commonly napa cabbage and Korean radishes.
This French delicacy made from snails, typically cooked with garlic, parsley, and butter, is known as a starter in upscale dining.
In Greek mythology, Zeus is the king of the gods and rules over this mountain.
Thor is a hammer-wielding god associated with thunder in this mythology.
In Hindu mythology, this god is known as the preserver and protector of the universe.
Anansi is a trickster figure often depicted as a spider in the folklore of this African culture.
In Aztec mythology, this god is often depicted as a feathered serpent.

final.clue: This civilization, spanning roughly 3,000 years, developed a writing system known as cuneiform and is credited with the creation of one of the world's first recorded law codes.
